title: Limitations of Seeking and Objectifying the Divine

questions.question: What is the main drawback of objectifying the divine?
choices: It creates a sense of separation between self and divine
It makes religious practices easier to understand
It simplifies complex theological concepts
It strengthens community bonds
questions.answer: It creates a sense of separation between self and divine

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a limitation of objectifying the divine?
choices: It can lead to anthropomorphism
It may result in literal interpretations of metaphorical teachings
It helps in developing a personal relationship with the divine
It can foster religious intolerance
questions.answer: It helps in developing a personal relationship with the divine

questions.question: What is non-dualism in spiritual contexts?
choices: The belief in two separate deities
The view that there is no fundamental separation between self and divine
The practice of worshipping multiple gods
The rejection of all spiritual beliefs
questions.answer: The view that there is no fundamental separation between self and divine

questions.question: In Timorese spiritual traditions, what concept reflects the interconnectedness of all things?
choices: Lulik
Maromak
Tara Bandu
Imago dei
questions.answer: Lulik

questions.question: What is anthropomorphism in the context of divine objectification?
choices: Treating animals as divine beings
Attributing human characteristics to the divine
Worshipping natural phenomena
Rejecting the existence of a higher power
questions.answer: Attributing human characteristics to the divine

questions.question: Which of the following is a potential benefit of objectifying the divine?
choices: It leads to a more inclusive worldview
It promotes non-dualistic thinking
It allows for the development of shared beliefs and practices
It eliminates the need for religious rituals
questions.answer: It allows for the development of shared beliefs and practices

questions.question: What is a common result of literal interpretation of religious texts?
choices: Increased spiritual flexibility
Development of rigid dogmas
Promotion of interfaith dialogue
Enhanced understanding of metaphorical meanings
questions.answer: Development of rigid dogmas

questions.question: In Timorese Catholicism, what concept reflects both transcendence and immanence of the divine?
choices: Lulik
Tara Bandu
Maromak
The integration of Catholic mysticism with indigenous beliefs
questions.answer: The integration of Catholic mysticism with indigenous beliefs

questions.question: Which spiritual tradition emphasizes the unity of all existence?
choices: Strict monotheism
Polytheism
Non-dualism
Atheism
questions.answer: Non-dualism

questions.question: What is the primary focus of non-dualistic spiritual practices?
choices: Seeking God as an external entity
Performing specific rituals to please the divine
Realizing one's inherent oneness with the divine
Categorizing different aspects of the divine
questions.answer: Realizing one's inherent oneness with the divine

questions.question: Which of the following is an example of objectifying the divine in Timorese traditions?
choices: Belief in the interconnectedness of all things
Veneration of ancestors
Depicting Maromak with human qualities
Recognizing the sacred nature of all existence
questions.answer: Depicting Maromak with human qualities

questions.question: What is the concept of 'imago dei' in Catholic tradition?
choices: The belief that God is unknowable
The idea that humans are made in God's image
The practice of creating religious icons
The rejection of anthropomorphic depictions of God
questions.answer: The idea that humans are made in God's image

questions.question: How does objectification of the divine potentially impact interfaith dialogue?
choices: It promotes understanding between different faiths
It has no effect on interfaith relations
It can foster religious intolerance or superiority complexes
It encourages the merging of different religious traditions
questions.answer: It can foster religious intolerance or superiority complexes

questions.question: What is a key characteristic of animistic beliefs in Timorese traditions?
choices: Strict separation between spiritual and physical realms
Belief in a single, omnipotent deity
Recognition of spirit presence in all things
Rejection of ancestral influences
questions.answer: Recognition of spirit presence in all things

questions.question: Which Christian mystic is mentioned as an example of non-dualistic thinking?
choices: St. Augustine
Meister Eckhart
Thomas Aquinas
John Calvin
questions.answer: Meister Eckhart

questions.question: What is the Tara Bandu ceremony in Timorese tradition?
choices: A wedding ritual
A coming-of-age ceremony
A ritual prohibition on certain activities
A harvest festival
questions.answer: A ritual prohibition on certain activities

questions.question: How does the concept of lulik in Timorese spirituality relate to non-dualism?
choices: It emphasizes the separation between sacred and profane
It represents a pervasive spiritual force not limited to specific objects
It promotes the worship of a single deity
It rejects the existence of spiritual realms
questions.answer: It represents a pervasive spiritual force not limited to specific objects

questions.question: What aspect of liberation theology reflects non-dualistic thinking?
choices: Emphasis on strict religious hierarchies
Focus on individual salvation
Separation of spiritual and social concerns
Recognition of God's presence in the struggle for justice
questions.answer: Recognition of God's presence in the struggle for justice

questions.question: Which Hindu philosophy is mentioned as an example of non-dualism?
choices: Dvaita
Advaita Vedanta
Samkhya
Yoga
questions.answer: Advaita Vedanta

questions.question: How does ancestor veneration in Timorese traditions reflect non-dualistic elements?
choices: It emphasizes the separation between living and dead
It promotes the worship of ancestors as separate deities
It recognizes the continuity between living and dead
It rejects the influence of ancestors on the living
questions.answer: It recognizes the continuity between living and dead

questions.question: What is a potential challenge in reconciling traditional beliefs with non-dualistic approaches in Timor-Leste?
choices: Lack of spiritual traditions in Timorese culture
Conflict with official Catholic doctrine
Absence of indigenous spiritual practices
Overwhelming support for non-dualism in all sectors of society
questions.answer: Conflict with official Catholic doctrine

questions.question: How might a non-dualistic approach to spirituality impact environmental stewardship in Timor-Leste?
choices: It would likely have no effect on environmental concerns
It might lead to increased exploitation of natural resources
It could foster a greater sense of interconnectedness with nature
It would probably result in the rejection of traditional conservation practices
questions.answer: It could foster a greater sense of interconnectedness with nature

questions.question: What is the primary difference between transcendence and immanence in spiritual contexts?
choices: Transcendence refers to male deities, while immanence refers to female deities
Transcendence suggests God exists beyond the physical world, while immanence suggests God's presence within it
Transcendence is a Christian concept, while immanence is exclusive to Eastern religions
Transcendence relates to polytheistic beliefs, while immanence is associated with monotheism
questions.answer: Transcendence suggests God exists beyond the physical world, while immanence suggests God's presence within it

questions.question: How does syncretic practice in Timorese spirituality relate to non-dualism?
choices: It reinforces the separation between different religious traditions
It has no relation to non-dualistic perspectives
It creates unique non-dualistic perspectives by blending different beliefs
It rejects all forms of traditional spirituality
questions.answer: It creates unique non-dualistic perspectives by blending different beliefs

questions.question: What is a potential benefit of exploring non-dualistic perspectives in spirituality?
choices: It simplifies complex theological concepts
It promotes a more inclusive and expansive understanding of spirituality
It strengthens the boundaries between different faith traditions
It eliminates the need for personal spiritual practice
questions.answer: It promotes a more inclusive and expansive understanding of spirituality

questions.question: How might objectification of the divine impact an individual's sense of self-worth?
choices: It always enhances self-esteem
It has no effect on self-worth
It may lead to feelings of unworthiness or disconnection
It guarantees a sense of divine favor
questions.answer: It may lead to feelings of unworthiness or disconnection

questions.question: What role does objectification of the divine play in the development of religious traditions?
choices: It has no significant role
It hinders the formation of shared beliefs
It allows for the development of common practices and beliefs
It always leads to the rejection of organized religion
questions.answer: It allows for the development of common practices and beliefs

questions.question: How does the concept of lulik in Timorese tradition challenge the objectification of the divine?
choices: It promotes the worship of specific objects
It emphasizes the sacred nature of all existence
It rejects any form of spirituality
It encourages the creation of religious icons
questions.answer: It emphasizes the sacred nature of all existence

questions.question: What is a potential drawback of non-dualistic approaches to spirituality?
choices: They always lead to religious intolerance
They may challenge established religious doctrines and practices
They promote a simplistic view of spirituality
They eliminate the possibility of personal spiritual experiences
questions.answer: They may challenge established religious doctrines and practices
